PAD_SharTempleVista.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_SharTempleVista.text: That almost looks like... no, it couldn't be, surely...
PAD_SharTempleVista.context: NodeContext: Awe/hesitation, as if doubting what she's seeing in the distance. Has not let the player know she is a shar worshipper.

AD_NoAnswerFromGod.speaker: Narrator
AD_NoAnswerFromGod.text: *There is no answer from the presence.*

AD_BOOOALAppears.speaker: BOOOAL
AD_BOOOALAppears.text: CUT YOU BREAK YOU TASTE YOU!

HighPriest.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
HighPriest.text: You've slain the pretender! We knew in our hearts the god BOOOAL was false.
HighPriest.context: NodeContext: In awe of you, rushing to affirm his faith - and absolutely means it

HighPriest.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
HighPriest.text: But you - we see you. We know you by your true name... MAHKLOOMPAH!
HighPriest.context: NodeContext: Kuo-Toa give overwrought, nonsensical names to their gods. Air of great ceremony as he bestows one on you

HighPriest.speaker: Karlach
HighPriest.context: NodeContext: Teasing you but pretending to be super into it

PAD_MagicGone.speaker: Player
PAD_MagicGone.text: Not much of a god after all. Whatever power he had, it died with those creatures.
PAD_MagicGone.context: NodeContext: BOO-al (not pronounced with extra emphasis, its just how the local fish people stylize it)

01.speaker: Player
01.text: Did you notice your spiders ran off?

01.speaker: Murmath
01.text: Eh? Oh, those worthless bugs. Always were the stupidest ones I ever raised. Hope the minotaurs get 'em.
01.context: NodeContext: Full of annoyance and anger

AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Gekh Coal
AD_CombatTurn.text: I am pain, I am torment, I am death.

Squad_Sniper.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Sniper.text: You'll want to speak with Gekh.

DeadDuergar_Dead.speaker: Narrator
DeadDuergar_Dead.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Henchmen_Surprised.text: What...? Gekh! Got someone sneaking up on us!
Henchmen_Surprised.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player sneaking.NodeContext: Raising the alarm. Doesn't need to be shouted - more of an urgent hiss

Henchmen_Surprised.speaker: Player
Henchmen_Surprised.text: Hold up your palms in peace.

Squad_Caster_AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Lurgan
Squad_Caster_AD_CombatTurn.text: Die, so your carcass can rise!

Squad_Wizard.speaker: Lurgan
Squad_Wizard.text: You'll want to speak to Gekh. He's in charge.
Squad_Wizard.context: NodeContext: Respectful towards a drow player.

Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn.text: I will split your corpse and roast the pieces!

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Saved.speaker: Beldron
Saved.text: Thanks again for offing that drow. Only made it here 'cause of you. But I can't stop thinking about the rest of us...

Saved.speaker: Beldron
Saved.text: ... stuck in Moonrise with a bunch of sadists. Poor bastards.

InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.text: *The gnome was under the protection of the myconid circle. They will see you answer for violating it.*

InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.text: She was in pain. I granted her mercy.

InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.text: *The myconid circle does not recognise your 'mercy' - but you will know its justice.*

Leader.speaker: Brathwen
Leader.text: Hey! Get back with the others. Now.

Looted.speaker: Narrator
Looted.text: *As you look at the skeletons, you realise they are all clad in the same dark armour.*
Looted.context: CinematicNodeContext: Surveying a group of Skeletons clad in Dark Justiciar uniforms (in game objects exist).

Looted.speaker: Player
Looted.text: Bow down and inspect the corpses more closely.

Looted.speaker: Narrator
Looted.text: *You immediately recognise the symbol of the Dark Lady - and you realise you know these uniforms.*

Looted.speaker: Narrator
Looted.text: *These people were Dark Justiciars, a reviled order within Shar's priesthood - one whose rite of entry includes killing a cleric of Sel√ªne.*

Looted.speaker: Player
Looted.text: To the dust! Die in filth!

Looted.speaker: Lae'zel
Looted.text: And better off still than being skewered by the point of my blade.

NereHeadLoot.speaker: Narrator
NereHeadLoot.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Nere's dead body.
CinematicNodeContext: player removes head off-camera - but does a terible job of it. You see the player grimace is blood splatters on them.

NereHeadLoot.speaker: Karlach
NereHeadLoot.text: Like watching a lemure eat porridge. Messy and unsettling.

NereHeadLoot.speaker: Narrator
NereHeadLoot.text: *You finish wresting the head from the drow's twisted neck.*
NereHeadLoot.context: CinematicNodeContext: Show player's face wincing as they remove the head. The body can remain off camera, head is raised up to be inspected.

03.speaker: Thudd
03.text: Good riddance. Hoon caused nothing but trouble.

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the duergar corpsesInternalNodeContext: Note: speaking of the duergar

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: You don't deserve the death you got. I should have made it last.
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the duergar corpses

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: As for the rest of you slave-worms - you've caused enough trouble.
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere rears back to cast a spell at the remaining gnomes
CinematicNodeContext: Nere fires the spell and the gnomes are dead.

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: This was meant to be a simple operation - I arrive, those pack animals clear the debris, and I walk into the temple.

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: Instead, I've been beset by incompetence, treachery, and now this. The Absolute's business remains unfinished.
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: On 'this' he gestures to the broken bridge in front of him.

FollowUp.speaker: Player
FollowUp.text: And what business is that, exactly?

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: Important business. My orders come from General Thorm himself.

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: I need you to deliver a message to him. Tell the General that I did what I could, but that the route through Grymforge is impassable.

FollowUp.speaker: Player
FollowUp.text: The General? Is he a favourite of the Absolute?

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: The favourite. Nothing is done in these lands without his knowledge.

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: *A faint voice echoes in your mind.*
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld: Nere is calling out to player from a distance

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: I sense you, True Soul... come to me, come to Nere... the poison spreads.
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: NodeContext: Voice goes in and out, as if the connection is weak

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Karlach
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: Did you hear that? The poor evil cultist needs our help.

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: *Nere's voice fades, but your head still tingles with his anger... and fear.*

Mindmeld.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld.text: *You make out only a few faint figures and scattered debris through Nere's eyes.*

HiddenGnome.context: CinematicNodeContext: Deep gnome conjures a fire in her hand.

HiddenGnome.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome.text: Hold it. I swear to Ironhand, one more step and I blow us to chunks!
HiddenGnome.context: NodeContext: Ready to blow you and her up.

HiddenGnome.speaker: Narrator
HiddenGnome.text: *An ashen scent fills the air. The barrel is filled with smokepowder.*

HiddenGnome.speaker: Narrator
HiddenGnome.text: *But the scent is acrid, as if contaminated somehow. Or much, much more concentrated.*

HiddenGnome.speaker: Karlach
HiddenGnome.text: She's gonna blow up. That's my thing.

HiddenGnome.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome.text: Shut your mouth, hoon, or I'll shut you down.
HiddenGnome.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to player companion.NodeContext: Hoon = outsider, an expletive of sorts. Pronounced like it is spelled.

HiddenGnome.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome.text: Calm down. Let's talk this through.

HiddenGnome.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome.text: What's to say? You're Nere's bootlicker - saw you sail in. A godsdamned True Soul.

HiddenGnome.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome.text: Better to die in this shit-heap than rot in Moonrise. You want me? Come get me.

HiddenGnome.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome.text: Laridda sent me. The gnomes need your help.

HiddenGnome.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome.text: Laridda? Drugning mind games. I know all about your tricks, True Soul.

HiddenGnome.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome.text: Gaerdal Ironhand, hear me now - set me free!
HiddenGnome.context: NodeContext: About to blow herself up, thinking she is dying an honorable death.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: He hid from the Hells' forces - but they still got to him.

PAD_RefuseNobleStalk.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_RefuseNobleStalk.text: Hardly the time for a repast. Later, maybe...
PAD_RefuseNobleStalk.context: NodeContext: Spoken to self. Lightly chastising herself for attempting to eat a mushroom at an inopportune moment.

AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: lava is disappearing from the floor
CinematicNodeContext: the golem is awakening in the pipe
CinematicNodeContext: the golem burst out from the pipe and open the grill gate
CinematicNodeContext: player reaction to the threat
CinematicNodeContext: An adamantine golem crawls from the fires of the adamantine forge and attacks players.

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

BroodingSovereign_Raft.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Raft.text: ((*I will not cross. painful memories beyond*))

BroodingSovereign_Raft.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_Raft.text: Stay in the grotto, then. I have to cross the lake.

Hermit_Dead.speaker: Player
Hermit_Dead.text: You're confused. I would never harm something as beautiful as your beloved.

MyconidDrow_Dead.speaker: Narrator
MyconidDrow_Dead.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

DisguisedJournal.speaker: Narrator
DisguisedJournal.text: *The cover proudly announces this book to be: 'Flumph Mating Rituals'.*
DisguisedJournal.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player holding the closed book, inspecting the cover
NodeContext: Flumph = FLUMF

DisguisedJournal.speaker: Narrator
DisguisedJournal.text: *If the drow's corpse is to be believed, it's something else entirely.*
DisguisedJournal.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player holding the closed book, inspecting the cover

DisguisedJournal.speaker: Player
DisguisedJournal.text: Try to peer through the illusion.

DisguisedJournal.speaker: Narrator
DisguisedJournal.text: *Strain as you might, your eyes find nothing but an overly detailed description of the flumph's reproductive process.*
DisguisedJournal.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player opens the book and studies the text before them

AD_FoundKey.speaker: Player
AD_FoundKey.text: A casting mould. Could put this to use at the forge.

CINE_HammerStrike.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the player character watches, the forge hammer descends and crashes into the dais below with a loud clang and a flash of sparks. It then rises back into its original position.

PAD_InteractingWithOrb.speaker: Player
PAD_InteractingWithOrb.text: Something's off. Pure shadow - around me, inside me.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: I know this design - Shar's faithful wield crossbows like these.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *A chill runs through you. Your magic - the fire that burns within is... fading.*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks at their hands in surprise

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: Close your eyes. Breathe into the feeling.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *Your magic gently and effortlessly flows from you - and into the sussur flower.*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes at beginning of line, head tilted back, as if enjoying the sensation

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Lae'zel
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: Your pace has slowed. Are you unwell?

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: It's the flower - my magic is gone.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Lae'zel
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: Then I shall make up for your shortcomings. As I have all along.
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: NodeContext: Not as snippy as usual. Subtly joking.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Lae'zel
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: Finely spotted. I've developed a taste for this pastime you call 'humour'.
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: NodeContext: Very pleased with herself that player realised she was joking

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Lae'zel
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: Now come, and be heedful. The shadows are watching.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: So those mushrooms can raise the dead? That's... interesting.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Handy magic, that. Maybe it'll be of use to us.

02.speaker: Stonemason Gergerann
02.text: If you aren't here to inspect the stonework, then get lost.

02.speaker: Stonemason Gergerann
02.text: And if you are... well, I doubt you've got anythin' useful to say.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Incredible. Every rock, every jewel tells a story.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: The most interesting secrets are alway lurking just under the surface.

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Curious - that stone there's been pried loose.

Boat.speaker: Narrator
Boat.context: InternalNodeContext: ~Should share sequence with *A vessel wobbles on the lake's murky waters.*

RaftEvent.speaker: Corsair Greymon
RaftEvent.text: You! What are you doing on Gekh's raft?

RaftEvent.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Another raft approaches. The Duergar on board pilot it next ot the player's craft. Novice Greymond stands opposite the player, the tiny gap between the boats seperating them.

RaftEvent.speaker: Player
RaftEvent.text: I seek the sergeant - I believe she's keen to get these boots back.

RaftEvent.speaker: Corsair Greymon
RaftEvent.text: Well I'll be - you got them. The sergeant's been whining non-stop.

RaftEvent.speaker: Corsair Greymon
RaftEvent.text: What about Gekh? Where's he at?

RaftEvent.speaker: Player
RaftEvent.text: He stayed behind to tie up some loose ends.

RaftEvent.speaker: Corsair Greymon
RaftEvent.text: More like avoiding the sergeant, I reckon.

RaftEvent.speaker: Corsair Greymon
RaftEvent.text: Come on - let's get you to shore. You're the one telling the sergeant what happened.

RaftEvent.speaker: Corsair Greymon
RaftEvent.text: The rest of you - keep patrolling. I'll be heading back with this one.

RaftEvent.speaker: Narrator
RaftEvent.text: *You continue forward in silence until the lights of a camp twinkle through the murk.*

DuergarBoatAtCave.speaker: Narrator
DuergarBoatAtCave.context: CinematicNodeContext: Boat sits in the water

CinematicNodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the shore with the party on board.InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.

DuergarBoatAtCamp.speaker: Narrator
DuergarBoatAtCamp.text: *The boat floats in the murky waters.*
DuergarBoatAtCamp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Boat floating in the water

InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be a few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.NodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the Grymforge dock with the party on board.

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Saved.speaker: Welso
Saved.text: You've done so much, I hate asking for more. But you see more slavers? Burn them, skin them - make them hurt.

01.speaker: Danna
01.text: Last time I trust a drow hoon.

02.speaker: Mirthis
02.text: Drugnin' Nere - glad you offed him. Ain't no one divides the clan and lives to tell the tale.

CaveIn.speaker: Skickpit
CaveIn.text: You've done more than I'd have hoped for. I should never have doubted.

PAD_OnPlatform2.speaker: Player
PAD_OnPlatform2.text: Platform's covered in rust - must be older than bonedust.

PAD_Reaction.speaker: Player
PAD_Reaction.context: NodeContext: Facing off against a large monster that's just burst out of the ground. Said with focus and determination, rather than fear.

PAD_IdolLooted.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_IdolLooted.text: An idol of Lady Shar. It's beautiful... Curious that I found it. Not the first sign of the Dark Lady's power that I've encountered.
PAD_IdolLooted.context: NodeContext: Admiring and intrigued. (SH is loyal to shar and known to worship her)

PAD_RecogniseStashLocation.speaker: Player
PAD_RecogniseStashLocation.text: Looks like the place the Dark Justiciar's letter mentioned. But where's the stash?

PAD_RecogniseWatchword.speaker: Player
PAD_RecogniseWatchword.text: Give a Light spell a try. That should get us into that chest.

PAD_KnowStashIsHidden.speaker: Player
PAD_KnowStashIsHidden.text: Must be in one of these chests.

002.speaker: Ward Pistle
002.text: You don't need nothing I've got.

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *Alcohol - an odd vice for duergar, prone to triggering ancestral memories of brutal illithid enslavement.*

LootingCorpse.speaker: Narrator
LootingCorpse.text: *Deep gnomes - killed under the yoke of slavers.*
LootingCorpse.context: CinematicNodeContext: Panning over small field of dead bodies.
CinematicNodeContext: Play bows their head, hands clasped, respecting the dead.

LootingCorpse.speaker: Shadowheart
LootingCorpse.text: Really? Save your prayers for someone who at least had the spine to fight back.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: Where's your pickaxe, gnome? Thrinn know you're over here?

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Viss
CorpseDisposers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spits on the groundNodeContext: Said like a threat.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Player
CorpseDisposers.text: She asked me to inspect the bodies for anything useful.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: You know - I don't think she did. I think you're trying to escape. We aren't gonna let that happen, are we, Viss?

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Viss
CorpseDisposers.context: NodeContext: Said matter-of-factly and threateningly, about to start combat.

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: Dry land. My guts'll stop churning now.
CampIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat arrives and the captain and players disembark.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Greymon, you shithead - time you showed up. We got trouble.

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: Spit it up, Morghal. Or you busy choking on that True Soul Nere's prick with Thrinn?

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Drugh no. The twat-Soul caused a rockfall. Trapped tighter than a ring on a fat finger.
CampIntro.context: NodeContext: DRUGH NO = FUCK NO. "Droog" like 'good', not 'food'.

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: You're shitting me. He pay up?

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: That's the trouble - he got the gold on him. Thrinn's arm's falling off what with the gnome slaves she been beating.

CampIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Who's the hoon, Greymon - another slave for the dig?

CampIntro.speaker: Player
CampIntro.text: Did I hear right? You keep gnomes as slaves?

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: Easy to feed, fat thumbs for digging. Won't find none better.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: But your type got their uses. Let's get those meat-paws to work.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Been wanting a reason to choke the life out of you, shit-for-brains.
CampIntro.context: NodeContext: Low rage, about to fight.

Camp.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Camp.text: You had our backs. Guess you True Souls ain't all bad.

Camp.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Camp.text: I mean, still don't like ya. But you're not a total gobshite. Bah. You buying?
Camp.context: NodeContext: Said roughly but with a tough of affection. 'Bah' cause greymon doesn't like talking about FEELINGS.

Camp.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Camp.context: NodeContext: Gruff but pleased. Greymon thinks better of the player.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: You're going up there? You've either got iron guts - or one of those Moonlanterns.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: One of Nere's magic lamps. You won't last without one.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: The death-dark's clogged the top-land, clear to Moonrise Towers. Only a Moonlantern dispels it.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: Shadows - thick as a duerro's skull. Sucks the breath right out of your lungs.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: Go on up, if you fancy. Me? I'd sooner take a swim in the Darklake.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Karlach
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: Must be the shadow curse. I really don't think we should go wandering in without protection.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Player
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: That Moonlantern is key to our survival. And that means freeing Nere.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Well I'll be ploughed sideways - we got a welcoming party.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat arrives. Greymon on a boat.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: You shithead - time you showed up. We got trouble.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Greymon. Projected from the boat. Morgha is talking to him from the shore.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Spit it out. Sergeant finally choked on True Soul Nere's prick?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Morghal, from the docking boat.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Drugh no. The Twat-Soul caused a rockfall. Trapped tighter than a ring on a fat finger.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player, his party and Greymon/Orgarth get off the boat.NodeContext: DRUGH NO = FUCK NO. "Droog" like 'good', not 'food'.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: You're shitting me. He pay up?

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: That's the trouble - he's got the gold on him. Sergeant's arm is falling off with all the gnome slaves she's been beating.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down after line is spoken.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Who's the hoon, Greymon - another slave for the dig?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Greymon, looking at player

Checkpoint.speaker: Lae'zel
Checkpoint.text: I am Lae'zel - daughter of Gith, defender of Vlaakith. And I am no slave.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Ooh - that one's feisty. Thrinn's gonna knock the snot right out of her.

Checkpoint.speaker: Player
Checkpoint.text: I am a True Soul. And you will treat me with respect.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Seen her run with a barrel under her arm. Just a small one, but enough to blow the drow out.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Someone should grab it. Slaves are never gonna manage with pickaxes.

Mutineers.speaker: Stone Guard Kur
Mutineers.text: Can't go chasing 'maybes' - the sergeant's our ticket in.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Would you look at that, Kur. Someone's having a listen.
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brithvar turns and notices player. Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Mutineers.speaker: Narrator
Mutineers.text: *A shiver runs through you. Your mind is awash in ancient resentments.*
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Not a mindmeld but a resonance due to duergar's psionic sensitivity.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: True Soul, no less. What do you think, Kur - should we take Nere's debt off them?
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Mutineers.speaker: Player
Mutineers.text: These True Souls are my enemies, not my allies.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Yet you got that Twat-Soul stench.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: If I didn't know better, I'd say a mind flayer shat a worm in your brain.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Should split your head open and poke around in there if you lot don't pay up.

Mutineers.speaker: Player
Mutineers.text: All I'm going to spill are your guts.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Big words - let's see you back them up.

Rothe_03.speaker: Deep Roth√©
Rothe_03.text: Grey ones make me work soon. Must sleep.
Rothe_03.context: NodeContext: Sighing. She knows there is little time to sleep before their next shift.

RotheDiscussion.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion.text: *The two roth√© moan quietly as lights flash about their heads.*
RotheDiscussion.context: CinematicNodeContext: *The two Roth√© paw the ground in irritation as lights flash about their heads.*

RotheDiscussion.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion.text: *The roth√© grunt softly at each other. Small lights flash about their heads in quick, erratic patterns.*
RotheDiscussion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Small lights flashing above rothe heads

RotheDiscussion.speaker: Player
RotheDiscussion.text: Still your body and quietly observe.

RotheDiscussion.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion.text: *One of the beasts seems exhausted. His lights flash in slow, methodical beats.*
RotheDiscussion.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Deep Rothe Calf's lights flash slowly

RotheDiscussion.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion.text: *You recognise the spell - Dancing Lights. It is how roth√© communicate with each other.*
RotheDiscussion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above both rothe

RotheDiscussion.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion.text: *The lights must mean something, but you can't interpret the flashes.*
RotheDiscussion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above both rothe

RebelsExtort.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort.text: Hold up, jargh. Y-you ain't just walking away.
RebelsExtort.context: NodeContext: Aggressive in their words, but something hesitant. They're afraid of you, they just don't want to show it.

RebelsExtort.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort.text: You got Brithvar chopped - and I still haven't seen a damned coin for my trouble.

RebelsExtort.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort.text: You owe - what's the word? Restitution.  ([6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

RebelsExtort.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort.text: That, or - or I add your corpse to the heap. Which is it?

RebelsExtort.speaker: Narrator
RebelsExtort.text: *You sense hesitation. The duergar talks tough, but fears you.*

RebelsExtort.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort.text: Clan, wrap it up. We've scraped this place for all its worth.
RebelsExtort.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

RebelsExtort.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort.text: It's time I scram, before the buggers at Moonrise charge in.

RebelsExtort.speaker: Player
RebelsExtort.text: I am freeing these gnomes. Just try and stop me.

RebelsExtort.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort.text: You don't need to ask twice, jargh.

Rothe_02.speaker: Elder Roth√©
Rothe_02.text: The Ketheric Thorm. The rocks hear, and tremble.

Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.speaker: Kirgrath
Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.text: Shit. Brithvar's kicked the tankard. Prick was older than dirt.

Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.speaker: Kirgrath
Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.text: Here's your cut. Just like Brithvar said. ([6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.speaker: Kirgrath
Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.text: Listen up, Clan Flameshade - we need to cut and run.
Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.speaker: Kirgrath
Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.text: It's time I scram, before the buggers at Moonrise charge in.

Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.speaker: Player
Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.text: I am freeing these gnomes. Just try and stop me.

Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.speaker: Kirgrath
Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.text: You don't need to ask twice, jargh.

HangedDrow_Dead.speaker: Narrator
HangedDrow_Dead.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Mutineers_FollowUp.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp.text: Sschindylryn's shithouse - you see it? Cock-stench had a wriggler in his skull. All the more reason to clear out.

Mutineers_FollowUp.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp.text: Here's your cut. I always keep my word. ([6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Mutineers_FollowUp.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp.text: Clan: grab your gear, wipe your arses.
Mutineers_FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

Mutineers_FollowUp.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp.text: Time I scrammed before more pricks from Moonrise Towers move in.

Mutineers_FollowUp.speaker: Player
Mutineers_FollowUp.text: I am freeing these gnomes. Just try and stop me.

Mutineers_FollowUp.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp.text: Your wish is my command, jargh.
